node.statement: PART (b) â€” DERIVATIVE EQUALS 1 (Laurent expansion setup). Fix k in {1,...,n}. Write the Taylor expansion of omega_1 about z = nu_k: omega_1(z) = lambda_{sigma(k)} + omega_1_prime(nu_k) * (z - nu_k) + (1/2) * omega_1_double_prime(nu_k) * (z - nu_k)^2 + O((z - nu_k)^3). Note omega_1_prime(nu_k) > 0 since omega_1 is monotone increasing at nu_k (from the Herglotz property, node 1.5(b)). Now substitute into the Laurent expansion of nG_p about w = lambda_{sigma(k)}: nG_p(w) = 1/(w - lambda_{sigma(k)}) + H_p(lambda_{sigma(k)}) + O(w - lambda_{sigma(k)}). Setting w = omega_1(z) and letting t = z - nu_k: nG_p(omega_1(z)) = 1/(omega_1_prime(nu_k) * t + (1/2)*omega_1_double_prime(nu_k)*t^2 + ...) + H_p(lambda_{sigma(k)}) + O(omega_1(z) - lambda_{sigma(k)}).
